description: From Latin tremendus (“fearful, terrible”), gerundive of tremō (“to tremble”), + -ous.

adjectives.description: tremendous (comparative more tremendous, superlative most tremendous)

entries.meaning: Notable for its size, power, or excellence.
examples: Van Beethoven's ninth symphony is a tremendous piece of music.

entries.meaning: Extremely large (in amount, extent, degree, etc.) or great
examples: There was a tremendous outpouring of support.
